title: Jacquinia pungens
text: Jacquinia pungens (syn. "Jacquinia macrocarpa" subsp. "pungens") is a species of <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a> in the family <a href="Primulaceae">Primulaceae</a>, native to southern <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. It is a <a href="shrub">shrub</a> growing to 4 m tall, with lanceolate to oblong <a href="evergreen">evergreen</a> <a href="leaf">leaves</a> 4–7 cm long, with a sharply pointed apex. The <a href="flower">flower</a>s are yellow, orange, or red, produced in tight <a href="raceme">raceme</a>s. The <a href="fruit">fruit</a> is a yellow <a href="Berry%20%28botany%29">berry</a>.
